summary: The Safe Stay Act (H.R. 3755) amends the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 to mandate the installation of compliant carbon monoxide alarms in all places of public accommodation. It defines compliant alarms based on International Fire Code and National Fire Protection Association standards.  Owners/operators must provide guests with written notice of compliance. Enforcement falls under the Federal Trade Commission, with penalties for violations. The Act takes effect one year after enactment.
